meanings.definition: The act of predicting or foreseeing future events.
meanings.sent1: Fortuning can involve looking at signs and symbols to guess what might happen next.
meanings.sent2: Her fortuning abilities allowed her to anticipate the outcome of the game.
meanings.sent3: The fortuning of the weatherman was always accurate, making him the go-to person for outdoor event planning.
meanings.sent4: His fortuning was like having a crystal ball, always knowing what was about to come.
meanings.sent5: The fortuning of the old wise woman was so precise that people traveled from far and wide seeking her advice.

meanings.definition: The state of being lucky or fortunate.
meanings.sent1: Winning the lottery was a stroke of fortuning that changed his life forever.
meanings.sent2: She considered herself in a constant state of fortuning, always finding good luck in every situation.
meanings.sent3: His friends joked that he must have a lucky charm hidden somewhere, attributing all his fortuning to it.
meanings.sent4: The fortuning of finding a four-leaf clover brought her unexpected joy on a dull day.
meanings.sent5: The fortuning of being born into a loving family is a blessing that should never be taken for granted.

meanings.definition: To bring good or bad luck to someone or something.
meanings.sent1: She believed that breaking a mirror would fortuning her with seven years of bad luck.
meanings.sent2: The black cat crossing his path fortuning a streak of misfortune that followed him all day.
meanings.sent3: He joked that his lucky socks would fortuning him to win every game he played.
meanings.sent4: The old legend said that finding a penny heads up would fortuning good luck to whoever picked it up.
meanings.sent5: The horseshoe above the door was said to fortuning protection and good luck to all who entered.
